original: shing skya // brgya byin shing //🔽su mtshan dbang dang nas bzang dang // nas kyi 'bras bu can zhes so //
analyzed: shing skya // brgya byin shing // su mtshan dbang dang nas bzang dang // nas kyi 'bras bu can zhes so //
translated: (The tree) of the gods is the śirīṣa.🔽(The tree) of Indra is the śālmali.🔽(The tree) of the sun is the śigru.🔽(The tree) of the moon is the barley.🔽(The tree) of the stars is the rice.🔽(The tree) of the planets is the wheat.🔽(The tree) of the herbs is the aśmantaka.🔽(The tree) of the trees is the aśvattha.

original: ka yi shing //
analyzed: ka yi shing //

original: 7 / ka r'i ra dang kra ka ra //

analyzed: 11 /'di dkar na aa la rka dang / rab tu gdung bcan no /
translated: If it is white, it is the alaka and the very tormenting.

original: 2 / kathishtha ra ni /
analyzed: 2 / kathishtha ra ni /
translated: The kathishara

original: brnas te / ku thi ra ka dang / ku thilla ka dag go //
analyzed: brnas te / ku thi ra ka dang / ku thilla ka dag go //
translated: is the nose, namely, the kutharaka and the kuthillaka.

original: 'di dkar na aardza ka dang / dri'i su can dang / bu thi ra ka'o //
analyzed: 'di dkar na aardza ka dang / dri'i su can dang / bu thi ra ka'o //
translated: If it is white, it is the arjaka, the fragrant, and the buthara.

original: sa m'i ra na dang / ma ru ba ka dang / brastha pushba dang / ha nidzdza ka dang / dzamb'i ra'o /
analyzed: sa m'i ra na dang / ma ru ba ka dang / brastha pushba dang / ha nidzdza ka dang / dzamb'i ra'o /
translated: The samirana, the maruvaka, the prastha-pushpa, the hanijjaka, and the jamvira.

original: 2 / de nas hr'i be ra ni lha'i sgra dang / chu'i ming can to //
analyzed: 2 / de nas hr'i be ra ni lha'i sgra dang / chu'i ming can to //
translated: Then the harivara is the divine sound and the name of a water.

original: d'a la dang / dri'i chu dang / barbhishti dag go / ganydzi ni dbang po dang / a'a sa ni ma'o //
analyzed: d'a la dang / dri'i chu dang / barbhishti dag go / ganydzi ni dbang po dang / a'a sa ni ma'o //
translated: The dala, the fragrant water, and the varbhishat. The gajini is the sense faculty, and the asani is the mother.

original: ka ni zhi ba'i lcug ma yin te //
analyzed: ka ni zhi ba'i lcug ma yin te //
translated: Ka is the twig of peace.

original: bu ka dang / phyugs bdag dang / nor dang / ae kashth'i la zhes pa'o //
analyzed: bu ka dang / phyugs bdag dang / nor dang / ae kashth'i la zhes pa'o //
translated: Bu ka, paśu-pati, dhana, and eka-sthala.

original: p'i thi ni tsi tra ka dang / me'i ming can te /
analyzed: p'i thi ni tsi tra ka dang / me'i ming can te /
translated: Pithi is citraka and the name of fire.

original: 'joms byed dang / snun byed dang / chu nad 'joms byed do /
analyzed: 'joms byed dang / snun byed dang / chu nad 'joms byed do /
translated: Jhaṭi, jaṭi, and udaka-jhaṭi.

original: 5 / shing za ba dang / sri srid 'gro ba dang / 'tsho byed dang / bya rog skyes dang / shing skye yang de'o /
analyzed: 5 / shing za ba dang / sri srid 'gro ba dang / 'tsho byed dang / bya rog skyes dang / shing skye yang de'o /
translated: Kaṭu, śrī-gati, jīvaka, kāka-jāta, and vṛkṣa-jāta.

original: 5 / de nas 'od ldan ma dang / til ser can dang / phug ron can dang / ainggu r'i dang / ro kha ba dang / 'dor byed dang / dka' thub sbyar dang / shing shun dang / phug ron rkang dang / ka ta bh'i dang /
analyzed: 5 / de nas 'od ldan ma dang / til ser can dang / phug ron can dang / ainggu r'i dang / ro kha ba dang / 'dor byed dang / dka' thub sbyar dang / shing shun dang / phug ron rkang dang / ka ta bh'i dang /
translated: Then, aruṇa, til-piṅga, kapotī, iṅguda, kaṭuka, utsṛṣṭa, tapo-dhana, vṛkṣa-tvac, kapotāṅga, and katabhi.

original: 'khri shing dang / pi n+ya na dang / sarka t'i'o /
analyzed: 'khri shing dang / pi n+ya na dang / sarka t'i'o /
translated: Lata, piṇyāka, and sarkāṭī.

original: 3 / gu d'u tsi dang / rgas med dang / ba dz'a dang / rgyud can dang / hi tv'a ka dang / mri t'a dang / pu bras dang / bcad skye dang / yangs pa dang / sbrang rtsi'i 'dab ma dang / 'tsho byed dang /
analyzed: 3 / gu d'u tsi dang / rgas med dang / ba dz'a dang / rgyud can dang / hi tv'a ka dang / mri t'a dang / pu bras dang / bcad skye dang / yangs pa dang / sbrang rtsi'i 'dab ma dang / 'tsho byed dang /
translated: Guduci, ageless, vajra, having a string, hitvaka, mrita, puti, born from a cut, vast, honey leaf, life-giving,

original: zla ba'i lcug ma rnams so /
analyzed: zla ba'i lcug ma rnams so /
translated: and moon creeper.

original: 12 / sha tha 'joms na x phu na rta b'a'o /
analyzed: 12 / sha tha 'joms na x phu na rta b'a'o /
translated: Sha-tha is jom-na, phu-na, and horse.

original: 2 / sabta l'a dang / krishna l'a dang / sle tres /
analyzed: 2 / sabta l'a dang / krishna l'a dang / sle tres /
translated: Satala, krsnala, and lettuce.

original: gser can dang / k'a k'a nytsi k'a dang / gunydza dang // brag mchog dang / dz'a tsa ru l'a dang / sa bon dmar po can dang / du rme sh'a dang / du byed @111b ma dang / 'dab ma dmar po dang / gtsug gi nor bu yang de'o /
analyzed: gser can dang / k'a k'a nytsi k'a dang / gunydza dang // brag mchog dang / dz'a tsa ru l'a dang / sa bon dmar po can dang / du rme sh'a dang / du byed @111b ma dang / 'dab ma dmar po dang / gtsug gi nor bu yang de'o /
translated: Golden, kakani, gundruk, excellent rock, jatarula, red seed, durmasha, smoke-colored, red leaf, and crest jewel.

original: 3 / kimb'a ka la ni /
analyzed: 3 / kimb'a ka la ni /
translated: In kimbaka,

original: ma h'a k'a la dang / au tu k'a la'o /
analyzed: ma h'a k'a la dang / au tu k'a la'o /
translated: mahakala and utkala.

original: 2 / de nas sapta l'a dang / dri'i rdzas dang / dri med ma dang / l'a ta l'a dang / dbu ba mang po dang / tsarma ka tha zhes pa yang ngo //
analyzed: 2 / de nas sapta l'a dang / dri'i rdzas dang / dri med ma dang / l'a ta l'a dang / dbu ba mang po dang / tsarma ka tha zhes pa yang ngo //
translated: Then Saptalā, fragrant substances, Vimala, Lātalā, much foam, and Carmakathā.

original: nag po dang / au ba ku lya dang / lus 'phags skyes dang / pispa l'i dang / g-yo ba dang / zegs ma dang / au sha n'a dang / m'a gha dd'i dang / ko l'a dang / sna ring sa dang / rtog med ma zhes pa rnams so /
analyzed: nag po dang / au ba ku lya dang / lus 'phags skyes dang / pispa l'i dang / g-yo ba dang / zegs ma dang / au sha n'a dang / m'a gha dd'i dang / ko l'a dang / sna ring sa dang / rtog med ma zhes pa rnams so /
translated: Kṛṣṇa, Upakulya, Vṛṣṇi, Piśācī, Cālikā, Rekhā, Uśanas, Māgadhī, Kolā, Dīrghaghrāṇā, and Akṛtā.

original: 11 / mdud ba can dang / pispa l'i dang / rtsa ba tshigs zug pa dang / bi k'a sh'i ra rnams so //
analyzed: 11 / mdud ba can dang / pispa l'i dang / rtsa ba tshigs zug pa dang / bi k'a sh'i ra rnams so //
translated: Granthi, Piśācī, Mūlasandhi, and Vikāśī.

original: spre'u 'i lcug ma dang / ko la'i lcug ma dang / dge legs ma dang / glang mo'i pi spa li dang / ba si ro n'a rnams so //
analyzed: spre'u 'i lcug ma dang / ko la'i lcug ma dang / dge legs ma dang / glang mo'i pi spa li dang / ba si ro n'a rnams so //
translated: Monkey creeper, Kolā creeper, Śubhaṅkarī, elephant Piśācī, and Vāsarā.

original: de nas tsa ki ka dang / dbyi mo dang / gzi brjid ma zhes pa yang ngo //
analyzed: de nas tsa ki ka dang / dbyi mo dang / gzi brjid ma zhes pa yang ngo //
translated: Then Cakikā, Iṣīkā, and Tejasvinī.

original: mdog med skyes dang / zla ba'i lcug ma dang / lcug ma bzang po dang / zla ba'i rgyal mo dang / lug nag ma dang / 'bras nag ma dang / b'a g'a dzi dang / rul pa'i 'bras bu yang ngo /
analyzed: mdog med skyes dang / zla ba'i lcug ma dang / lcug ma bzang po dang / zla ba'i rgyal mo dang / lug nag ma dang / 'bras nag ma dang / b'a g'a dzi dang / rul pa'i 'bras bu yang ngo /
translated: The names of the six types of barley are: the white one, the black one, the one with a black tip, the one with a black middle, the one with a black base, and the one with a black husk.

original: 8 / shu dag dang / dri mchog dang / mdung ma drug pa dang / tshigs brgya pa dang / sa yi spu dang / dag phan dang / dri rtsub zhes par 'gyur ro /
analyzed: 8 / shu dag dang / dri mchog dang / mdung ma drug pa dang / tshigs brgya pa dang / sa yi spu dang / dag phan dang / dri rtsub zhes par 'gyur ro /
translated: The names of the six types of wheat are: the one with a black tip, the one with a black middle, the one with a black base, the one with a black husk, the one with a black beard, and the one with a black grain.

original: 7 / de nyid dkar po la gser ldan ma zhes so //
analyzed: 7 / de nyid dkar po la gser ldan ma zhes so //
translated: The same one, if white, is called the golden one.🔽The names of the six types of sesame are: the black one, the beautiful one, the excellent one, the one with a black tip, the one with a black middle, and the one with a black base.

original: yung ba la ni ni sh'a dang / mdog mdzes ma dang / mdog mchog dang / ka tam dang / ka me ri dang / rul ldan ma dang / gser ldan ma dang / gser 'joms ma dang / ser mo dang / khu ser ma dang /
analyzed: yung ba la ni ni sh'a dang / mdog mdzes ma dang / mdog mchog dang / ka tam dang / ka me ri dang / rul ldan ma dang / gser ldan ma dang / gser 'joms ma dang / ser mo dang / khu ser ma dang /
translated: The names of the six types of beans are: the one with a black tip, the one with a black middle, the one with a black base, the one with a black husk, the golden one, and the one that destroys gold.

original: ganda s'a l'a dang / sh'i s'i dang / ta p'a la k'a dang / la b'a dang / pra gha r'a n'i rnams so /
analyzed: ganda s'a l'a dang / sh'i s'i dang / ta p'a la k'a dang / la b'a dang / pra gha r'a n'i rnams so /
translated: The names of the six types of lentils are: the yellow one, the one with yellow flowers, the one with a yellow base, the one with a yellow husk, the one with a yellow beard, and the one with a yellow grain.🔽The names of the six types of beans are: the one with a black tip, the one with a black middle, the one with a black base, the one with a black husk, the one with a black beard, and the one with a black grain.

original: 16 / de nas 'o ma dang / rnam par 'jo ba dang / mtshungs so //
analyzed: 16 / de nas 'o ma dang / rnam par 'jo ba dang / mtshungs so //
translated: Then, milk, curd, and so on are similar.

original: ae la'i shun pa dang / dri bzang dang / pra tsi k'a dang / pags pa las byung ba dang / sa mo dang / zla ba gzhon nu ma dang / nishku ti ba hu l'a dang / tsa b'a dang / sbom mo rnams so /
analyzed: ae la'i shun pa dang / dri bzang dang / pra tsi k'a dang / pags pa las byung ba dang / sa mo dang / zla ba gzhon nu ma dang / nishku ti ba hu l'a dang / tsa b'a dang / sbom mo rnams so /
translated: skin resin,🔽earth resin,🔽young moon resin,🔽niṣka resin,🔽cavā resin,🔽and thick resin.🔽The five types of root are:🔽dry ginger,🔽long pepper,🔽black pepper,🔽white pepper,

original: 9 / sug smel dang / ru tthda  dang / ka rang g'i dang / phur ma gsum pa dang / gcod byed dang / phug ron mdog dang / ma la ya skyes dang / au pa ku nytsi k'a dang / shing ldan dang / 'dab ma dang /
analyzed: 9 / sug smel dang / ru tthda  dang / ka rang g'i dang / phur ma gsum pa dang / gcod byed dang / phug ron mdog dang / ma la ya skyes dang / au pa ku nytsi k'a dang / shing ldan dang / 'dab ma dang /
translated: and the root of the three-leaved plant.🔽The five types of fruit are:

original: shing ser @112a * //
analyzed: shing ser @112a * //
translated: the fruit of the pomegranate tree,🔽the fruit of the katamkata tree,🔽the fruit of the katamkatīra tree,🔽the fruit of the satadru tree,🔽the fruit of the seasonal tree,

original: dang / ka tam ka ti dang / ka tam ka ti r'i dang / s'i ta dru dang / dus su skyes pa dang / ljang ser mdog dang / par++yan+ya dang / par++ya n'i dang / p'i ta k'ashatham dang / b'i ta na ra kam rnams so /
analyzed: dang / ka tam ka ti dang / ka tam ka ti r'i dang / s'i ta dru dang / dus su skyes pa dang / ljang ser mdog dang / par++yan+ya dang / par++ya n'i dang / p'i ta k'ashatham dang / b'i ta na ra kam rnams so /
translated: the fruit of the green-yellow tree,🔽the fruit of the parya tree,🔽the fruit of the paryaṇī tree,🔽the fruit of the pītakāṣṭha tree,🔽and the fruit of the pītanarak tree.

original: 21 / le brgan dang / bi ka kha dang / dzingg'i dang / yang dag lus ma dang / lus nag ma dang / sbal pa'i 'dab ma dang / bh'anda r'i dang / bhandi ya dang / chu'i lcug ma dang / dri bzang rtsa ba dang /
analyzed: 21 / le brgan dang / bi ka kha dang / dzingg'i dang / yang dag lus ma dang / lus nag ma dang / sbal pa'i 'dab ma dang / bh'anda r'i dang / bhandi ya dang / chu'i lcug ma dang / dri bzang rtsa ba dang /
translated: red, bikha, jinga, perfect body, black body, frog leaf, bhandara, bhandīya, water creeper, fragrant root,

original: rlung 'joms ma dang / bkra ba'i 'dab ma can ma rnams so /
analyzed: rlung 'joms ma dang / bkra ba'i 'dab ma can ma rnams so /
translated: wind-conquering, and variegated leaf.🔽The twenty-two are:

original: 12 / ganthi parni dang / mdud pa'i lo ma dang / ka ba skyes dang ; / mdud pa can dang / dri bzang dang / shing dkar dang / ne tso dang / rma bya dang / me tog sbom po /
analyzed: 12 / ganthi parni dang / mdud pa'i lo ma dang / ka ba skyes dang ; / mdud pa can dang / dri bzang dang / shing dkar dang / ne tso dang / rma bya dang / me tog sbom po /
translated: ganthipari, knotted leaf, pillar-born, knotty, fragrant, white wood, parrot, peacock, and thick flower.

original: kukku ri rnams so /
analyzed: kukku ri rnams so /
translated: The twenty-three are:

original: 10 / sbrang can dang / shing mngar dang / kl'i ta kam dang / ma dhu yashti k'a dang / yashti ma dhu k'a rnams so //
analyzed: 10 / sbrang can dang / shing mngar dang / kl'i ta kam dang / ma dhu yashti k'a dang / yashti ma dhu k'a rnams so //
translated: bee, sweet wood, kalataki, madhuyastika, and yastimaduka.

original: de nas nang can dang / ru rta dang / mri tpa lam dang / lus ngan skyes dang / 'od 'bar dang / bya ba dang / yongs su bsgo pa dang / smin pa can dang / dbyug pas mtshan pa rnams so //
analyzed: de nas nang can dang / ru rta dang / mri tpa lam dang / lus ngan skyes dang / 'od 'bar dang / bya ba dang / yongs su bsgo pa dang / smin pa can dang / dbyug pas mtshan pa rnams so //
translated: Then, the one with the inner, the one with the horse, the one with the tree, the one with the body, the one with the light, the one with the action, the one with the complete order, the one with the ripened, and the one with the stick.

original: 'di'i rtsa ba padma'i rtsa ba dang / dpa' bo rgyas byed dang / kshm'i ra dang // padma'i 'dab ma dang / nee rnams so /
analyzed: 'di'i rtsa ba padma'i rtsa ba dang / dpa' bo rgyas byed dang / kshm'i ra dang // padma'i 'dab ma dang / nee rnams so /
translated: The root of this is the root of the lotus, the hero, the expanding, the kṣamīra, the lotus leaf, and the ne.

original: 5 / mon gyi tikta dang / sa'i nim pa dang / mon skyes ma dang / 'gro byed ti kta ka dang / yun rings tikta ka dang / gser can rnams mtshungs so /
analyzed: 5 / mon gyi tikta dang / sa'i nim pa dang / mon skyes ma dang / 'gro byed ti kta ka dang / yun rings tikta ka dang / gser can rnams mtshungs so /
translated: The Tibetan tka, the nimba of the earth, the one born in Tibet, the goer, the tka of the bitter, the long-lasting tka, and the golden ones are similar.

original: 7 / sa'i tshor gzem ma dang / sa'i 'gyur byed can dang / tsher ma gsum sbyar ba dang / kshu ra dang / sa lam ka sha dang / bur shing dri dang / so dang / cher ma mngar ba dang / thang gi rva can dang /
analyzed: 7 / sa'i tshor gzem ma dang / sa'i 'gyur byed can dang / tsher ma gsum sbyar ba dang / kshu ra dang / sa lam ka sha dang / bur shing dri dang / so dang / cher ma mngar ba dang / thang gi rva can dang /
translated: The earth, the feeling, the one with the blanket, the one with the change of the earth, the three thorns combined, the sugar, the salt, the scent of sugarcane, the tooth, the sweet of the great, and the one with the horn of the plain.

original: ke rva ye rva can dang / kha dog gsum pa rnams so /
analyzed: ke rva ye rva can dang / kha dog gsum pa rnams so /
translated: The one with the horn of the mountain, the one with the horn of the three colors.

original: 11 / bur shing dri dang / k'andi kshu dang / khu byug mig dang / kshu ra dang / kshu ra'o /
analyzed: 11 / bur shing dri dang / k'andi kshu dang / khu byug mig dang / kshu ra dang / kshu ra'o /
translated: Sugarcane smell, kandīka, cuckoo eye, sugar, and sugar cane.

original: 6 / au shya pra sto dang / mi 'jigs 'dab can ma dang / rtsa ba brgya ma dang / brgya mchog ma dang / sred med dang / bu mangs ma dang / 'jigs med ma dang / dbang mo dang / ba r'i ba r'a dang /
analyzed: 6 / au shya pra sto dang / mi 'jigs 'dab can ma dang / rtsa ba brgya ma dang / brgya mchog ma dang / sred med dang / bu mangs ma dang / 'jigs med ma dang / dbang mo dang / ba r'i ba r'a dang /
translated: Uśīra, fearless, hundred roots, best of hundreds, Nārāyaṇa, many sons, fearless, powerful, and varāha.

original: a'a he ru rnams so /🔽10 / au shya pro ksha ni /
analyzed: a'a he ru rnams so / 10 / au shya pro ksha ni /
translated: Āhe ru.

original: spre'u mo dang / pam ka simba k'a dang / bdag sbas ma dang / skyes ma dang / @112b hyanda dang / kantu r'a dang / rab char 'bebs ma dang / nags kyi mi 'dra dang / spre'u sngo can rnams so //
analyzed: spre'u mo dang / pam ka simba k'a dang / bdag sbas ma dang / skyes ma dang / @112b hyanda dang / kantu r'a dang / rab char 'bebs ma dang / nags kyi mi 'dra dang / spre'u sngo can rnams so //
translated: Uśīra, monkey, pamka, simba, hidden self, born, hyena, kantu, and heavy rain.

original: rva can ni au sha bha dang / aashta barsha pa ti ta /
analyzed: rva can ni au sha bha dang / aashta barsha pa ti ta /
translated: Horned, uśīra, and eight-year-old.

original: de'i ausha bh'a shya ni pri sha'o /
analyzed: de'i ausha bh'a shya ni pri sha'o /
translated: His uśīra is priyāla.

original: 3 / ba lang bsrung ba'i 'bras dang / klu'i stobs dang / mjug ma dang / 'dab ma can dang / gangge ru p'a tsa dang / shin tu stobs ma dang / au sha dang / thung du ga be tyu k'a rnams so /
analyzed: 3 / ba lang bsrung ba'i 'bras dang / klu'i stobs dang / mjug ma dang / 'dab ma can dang / gangge ru p'a tsa dang / shin tu stobs ma dang / au sha dang / thung du ga be tyu k'a rnams so /
translated: The cowherds' fruit, the naga-power, the tail, the winged, the Ganges-river-flower, the very powerful, the uśa, and the short-tailed gavaya.

original: 7 / ba la'i dbye ba la lu ti p'a l'a dang / ba l'a dang / ba titm'a dang / spyod pa'i me tog ma dang / b'a tya la gen ri'o //
analyzed: 7 / ba la'i dbye ba la lu ti p'a l'a dang / ba l'a dang / ba titm'a dang / spyod pa'i me tog ma dang / b'a tya la gen ri'o //
translated: The divisions of the cow are the luti-pāla, the bāla, the bātimā, the conduct-flower, and the vāt-yalagiri.

original: go dh'a pa d'i ni legs 'bab ma dang / 'dab gsum ma dang / dang ba'i rkang ma yang ngo /
analyzed: go dh'a pa d'i ni legs 'bab ma dang / 'dab gsum ma dang / dang ba'i rkang ma yang ngo /
translated: The godāvarī is the good-flowing, the three-leaf, and the clear-footed.

original: 4 / aa spo t'a ri'i rna ba yin te /
analyzed: 4 / aa spo t'a ri'i rna ba yin te /
translated: The aśpota-r is the ear.

original: khyab 'jug gnod pa dang / gzhan gyis mi thub pa dang / ba lang zas dang / gi ri ka shla dang / thang gi me tog pa dang / ba shi yang de'o //
analyzed: khyab 'jug gnod pa dang / gzhan gyis mi thub pa dang / ba lang zas dang / gi ri ka shla dang / thang gi me tog pa dang / ba shi yang de'o //
translated: The Viṣṇu-harm, the unconquerable, the cow-food, the giri-kaśmīra, the field-flower, and the bāṣi are also that.

original: de nas ba ka na smin pa'i ma dang / seng ge ma dang / b'a sa k'a dang / bri sh'a dang / gnas can ma dang / aa ta ru sha dang / seng ge can ma dang / rta so can rnams so /
analyzed: de nas ba ka na smin pa'i ma dang / seng ge ma dang / b'a sa k'a dang / bri sh'a dang / gnas can ma dang / aa ta ru sha dang / seng ge can ma dang / rta so can rnams so /
translated: Then there are the women of Bakana, the women of Simhapura, the women of Vasa, the women of Bhasa, the women of Sthula, the women of Atarusha, the women of Simhaladvīpa, and the women of Aśvamukha.

original: 8 / ku nas 'o ma dang / a'a b'i dang / ganda dang / rdo rje du b'u ka dang / sgu h'i dang / gu h'a ma rnams so //
analyzed: 8 / ku nas 'o ma dang / a'a b'i dang / ganda dang / rdo rje du b'u ka dang / sgu h'i dang / gu h'a ma rnams so //
translated: There are the women of Kunala, the women of Avati, the women of Gandha, the women of Vajra, the women of Guha, and the women of Guhaman.

original: bi dam ga dang / don yod dang / 'bras dang / 'bras khra bo dang / kri ma /
analyzed: bi dam ga dang / don yod dang / 'bras dang / 'bras khra bo dang / kri ma /

analyzed: s'a rangga / bandhi //

analyzed: 10 / khug rta gzhon nu ts'a s'i ha // zangs kyi gtsug phud kri ka sgrog /

analyzed: bya gag rkang pa'i mtshon cha can //

analyzed: snga bar sgra sgrogs mtshan mo rig / mig zlum ka l'a bi ka dang // s'a la 'gro ma mkhas tsa ta ka / zung gi dbyangs sgrog mtshan mo skad //

analyzed: gso byed 'phel byed dang // pags pa'i gtsug phud mya ngan med //

analyzed: khyim du nyal //

analyzed: d'a ksh'a tya //

analyzed: tshogs pa'i dbye ba sde tshan mtshungs //

original: rigs mthun dang ni /🔽chos mthun pa //
analyzed: rigs mthun dang ni / chos mthun pa //

analyzed: dud 'gro'i khyu dang phyugs kyi tshogs //

original: gzhan rnams la ni 'dus par 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan rnams la ni 'dus par 'gyur //

analyzed: 'ga' zhig don mthun tshogs pa'i tshogs // phung po / mchod rten /

analyzed: spungs dang / tshogs // brtsegs pa'o phug ron tshegs dang ni //
translated: The class of the assembly is, for example, an assembly of monks.🔽The class of the nest is, for example, a nest of pigeons.🔽The class of the flock is, for example, a flock of parrots.

original: ne tso'i tshogs dang rma bya'i tshogs //
analyzed: ne tso'i tshogs dang rma bya'i tshogs //
translated: The class of the herd is, for example, a herd of deer.🔽The class of the group is, for example, a group of birds.

original: sreg pa'i tshogs sogs de yi tshogs //
analyzed: sreg pa'i tshogs sogs de yi tshogs //
translated: The class of the group is, for example, a group of householders.🔽The class of the group is, for example, a group of animals.🔽The class of the group is, for example, a group of birds.🔽The class of the group is, for example, a group of deer.🔽The class of the group is, for example, a group of people.🔽The class of the group is, for example, a group of animals.🔽The class of the group is, for example, a group of birds.

original: khyim gnas bya dang ri dags dang // de dag lhag ma 'ga' zhig gzung //

analyzed: tyaktva nyam / yadpa sha: sri ya y'a su kalpi ti telpa sti sunda r'i /
translated: Having given up his kingdom, his retinue, his army, and his wealth,🔽And having left his father and mother, he went forth.🔽Having gone forth, he wandered about,🔽And having seen the four sights, he left the city at midnight.🔽Having gone to the forest, he sat down at the foot of a tree,🔽And having seen the four truths, he attained the five superknowledges.🔽Having attained the five superknowledges, he became a buddha,

original: du t'i k'a pre shya yatma ta: ba r'e gam kr'i ta sam /
analyzed: du t'i k'a pre shya yatma ta: ba r'e gam kr'i ta sam /

original: ko to re: na mam la ti pri ya ;
analyzed: ko to re: na mam la ti pri ya ;

original: 4 / y'a ba dhirma pri ya ko p'a ta ts'a tu ka ra nytsa ni rga t'a t'i sya ta 3 nu sha ye: panytsa tka la hanta ri t'i hi p'a /

translated: Having attained the fruit of stream-entry, they said, We will go forth in the presence of the Blessed One.🔽Having said that, they went forth in the presence of the Blessed One.

original: 5 / au ta kintha t'a tu p'a ya sy'a b'a pa /
analyzed: 5 / au ta kintha t'a tu p'a ya sy'a b'a pa /
translated: Having gone forth, they attained the fruit of once-returning.

translated: Having attained the fruit of once-returning, they said, We will go forth in the presence of the Blessed One.🔽Having said that, they went forth in the presence of the Blessed One.🔽Having gone forth, they attained the fruit of non-returning.🔽Having attained the fruit of non-returning, they said, We will go forth in the presence of the Blessed One.🔽Having said that, they went forth in the presence of the Blessed One.
